    • Method Detail

      • find

        @SafeVarargs
public static Enum<?> find(Pattern pattern,
                       boolean nullOK,
                       Action action,
                       Class<? extends Enum<?>>... enums)
        Find an Enum constant matched by the specified Pattern.

        Although this method can find any constant name in any Enum, it is most useful for finding constants in large Enums or sets of Enums. To find constants in specified BuiltIn Enum classes that implement Naomi's BuiltInInterface, use find(Pattern pattern,boolean nullOK,Action action).

        Although this method can find an Enum matching any Naomi Pattern, the GlobPattern has been provided to allow the user to search for Enum names in a way that is analogous to searching for filenames in Unix.

        Note the use of ".class" in the examples below, to refer to class arguments.

        Parameters:
        pattern - An instance of Pattern to be matched by an enum constant
        nullOK - If no constant is found, return null instead of throwing a Utilities.SearchException
        action - Action to take if multiple matches are found
        enums - Enums whose constants are to be searched for
        Returns:
        null or a constant, matched by pattern, of one of the enums
        Throws:
        ReuseException
        Utilities.SearchException -
        Examples: 
            Pattern pattern=new GlobPattern("p*");
    Enum ans =
      Utilities.find(pattern, false, Action.last, Policy.class);
        will return Policy.positiveLookbehind

        As an additional example: 

            Pattern glob=new GlobPattern("gre*").setCaseSensitive(false);
    BuiltInInterface const1 =
        Utilities.find(glob, true, Action.last, UniScriptBuiltIn.class);
        returns UniScriptBuiltIn.GREEK.

      • find

        public static BuiltInInterface find(Pattern pattern,
                    boolean nullOK,
                    Action action)
        Find a BuiltIn Enum constant of CoreBuiltIn, LocaleBuiltIn, UniBlockBuiltIn, or UniScriptBuiltIn (searched in that order), matched by the specified Pattern.

        Although this method can find an Enum matching any Naomi Pattern, the GlobPattern class has been provided to allow the user to search for Enum names in a way that is analogous to searching for filenames in Unix.

        Parameters:
        pattern - An instance of Pattern to be matched by an enum constant
        nullOK - If no constant is found, return null instead of throwing a Utilities.SearchException
        action - Action to take if multiple matches are found
        Returns:
        null or a constant matched by pattern, of one of the enums
        Throws:
        ReuseException
        Utilities.SearchException -
        Example: 
            BuiltInInterface const =
      Utilities.find(new GlobPattern("Vis*").setCaseSensitive(false),
                       false, Action.exception);
        will set const to CoreBuiltIn.visible. To create a CharClass using this constant: 
             new BuiltInCharClass(const);
